column13: [Build] Rework the patch adding the --prefix=DIR bootStrap.bash option
column20:
I'm sorry for bothering again with a pull request, but the first shot was just too bad. This patch does away with some bad practices like not translating positional arguments into local variables immediately in dir_check(), adds option_name() helper function for more automation and replaces a hardcoded value for the default prefix value in usage() with a variable.
The patch has been tested and WFM.

column13: [Editor][UI] Add unified undo/redo for segments and markers
column20:
My apologies for being impatient. This patch implements a unified undo/redo queue both for segments and markers, moving the undo functionality from segment management one level higher into the composer and adding a "Redo" item with Ctrl+Y shortcut to the "Edit" menu. The new functions ADM_Composer::addToUndoQueu, ADM_Composer::undo, ADM_Composer::redo and ADM_Composer::clearUndoQueue get called now directly from UI actions.
A few notes: Undoing or redoing a cut/delete/paste operation bypasses the position adjustment logic implemented in ACT_Cut/Delete/Paste. This is a design limitation. Ideally, the undo queue would become action-aware and the implementation would provide a clue for GUI to disable not applicable options.
While I can't tell from my zero level of experience if the patch suffers from bad coding practices, it has been quite extensively tested and WFM.
column21:

Ideally, the undo queue would become action-aware and the implementation would provide a clue for GUI to disable not applicable options.
While I can't tell from my zero level of experience if the patch suffers from bad coding practices, it has been quite extensively tested and WFM.

column13: [UI] Work around tabbing order issues in the 'Display' tab of the preferences dialog
column20:
This patch fixes or rather works around the keyboard navigation issue described in Strange tab order in Edit / Prefences / Display. It seems that there is currently no way to set tabbing order of dialog elements unambiguously, which means that elements get ordered in "first come, first served" manner. Oddly enough, this doesn't lead to problems except of in the Display tab of the preferences dialog, where the tabbing order is very wrong.
The patch combines three top-level elements into a second frame, ordered below the first one. This is enough to correct the tabbing order, according to my testing, and looks quit similar to the current design.
The title of the additional frame, "GUI Rendering Options", seems to match the meaning of the options below, but I don't insist on it. An empty string as title results in a big gap between elements which looks odd though.
An alternative to a second frame would be moving framePP to the end of the list, but this doesn't fit the logic of the dialog well, IMVHO.
column21:

The patch combines three top-level elements into a second frame, ordered below the first one. This is enough to correct the tabbing order, according to my testing, and looks quit similar to the current design.
The title of the additional frame, "GUI Rendering Options", seems to match the meaning of the options below, but I don't insist on it. An empty string as title results in a big gap between elements which looks odd though.

column13: [i18n] .ts files regenerated, German and a minor Russian update, broken lupdate heuristics disabled
column20:
Assuming that the work on DXVA2 is mostly finished, I've regenerated .ts files, added some new and modified existing German and (a few) Russian translations, especially for recently added strings.
The cause of the breakage of the Russian and pt_BR translation is identified and remedied: it was lupdate "number" heuristic going wild. I've disabled the "sametext" heuristic as well, it is a pain to deal with such automated changes.
column21:
Assuming that the work on DXVA2 is mostly finished, I've regenerated .ts files, added some new and modified existing German and (a few) Russian translations, especially for recently added strings.
The cause of the breakage of the Russian and pt_BR translation is identified and remedied: it was lupdate "number" heuristic going wild. I've disabled the "sametext" heuristic as well, it is a pain to deal with such automated changes.

column13: [UI] Allow minimizing to notification area from encoding dialog, remove preference setting
column20:
This patch adds a button to the left bottom part of the encoding dialog wired to minimize to notification area AKA tray function. In reverse, the patch removes the useTray preference setting and changes the API for DIA_encodingBase and all related functions accordingly.
This solution moves the user decision whether to minimize to notification area or not to the dialog which provides context for this decision. Furthermore, this design avoids confusion when the first pass of a 2-pass encoding doesn't minimize to notification area despite the relevant setting being set.
The patch has been tested on Linux and WFM.
Reference: Avidemux 2.6.4 - Minimize to notification area.

column13: [Qt] Restore correct window state upon finishing encoding while minimized to notification area
column20:
This patch fixes UI_deiconify to take the last window state into account instead of always trying to restore to a normal window (Avidemux window retaining the maximized state when manually restored from "tray" on Linux even without this patch must be a bug in gnome-shell or Qt).
While tested WFM on Linux, I'm pretty confident that this patch should fix the issue on Windows as well.
Reference: Avidemux 2.6.4 - Minimize to notification area

column21: In which way is this accel key confusing? Are you going to re-add the accel key via avidemux_en.ts? Otherwise I'd object to removing it before some reasonable keyboard accessibility has been implemented (currently Avidemux intercepts a lot of important keys as navigation commands even if no video is loaded, which renders Avidemux GUI almost completely inaccessible via keyboard). Accel key conflicts should be resolved, of course. There is none in the English locale in this case.

column13: Remove (confusing) accel key from TimeShift left panel checkbox.
column20: See French translation
column21:
I can't spot any misbehaviour related to the accel key for the TimeShift chechbox with the English locale, especially I can't reproduce the mentioned interaction with the "File" menu, at least on Linux and on Windows 7.
Defining accel keys in translation files makes the source better searchable and the whole thing more flexible. A drawback would be a lack of accelerators if translations are not installed (e.g. on Linux they are often split into a separate package).
If there is an accel key conflict in the French locale, it should be resolved in avidemux_fr.ts.
Finally, your change means a string change and would require all .ts files to be regenerated (I don't know whether lupdate is clever enough to keep the existing translations, in worst case .ts files which have translations for &Shift: would require manual editing).

column13: [Core/FFmpeg] Do not try to patch already patched common.mak, unbreak --rebuild option
column20: As of [core/ffmpeg] fix patching  the code in cmake/admFFmpegBuild_native.cmake:18 tries to patch common.mak no matter what, breaking the build with --rebuild option as a result. This patch takes into account the value of the FFMPEG_PERFORM_PATCH env variable.

column13: [UI/Render] Disable faulty check for remote display breaking VDPAU
column20: On Fedora and probably other distributions with GNOME and gdm as display manager the default value for $DESKTOP is :1 for the local display, thus resulting in hardware accelerated video output in Avidemux wrongly disabled. Let us please disable the check for $DISPLAY == :0 which does much more harm than good.
column21: On Fedora and probably other distributions with GNOME and gdm as display manager the default value for $DESKTOP is :1 for the local display, thus resulting in hardware accelerated video output in Avidemux wrongly disabled. Let us please disable the check for $DISPLAY == :0 which does much more harm than good.

Thank you for your contribution. A few notes:

Translations marked as obsolete have no effect, it is a waste of time to correct them.
Many English strings have keyboard accelerators, you don't provide any equivalents for cyrillic layout. Why? Keyboard accessibility is awesome.
When translating strings containing markup (even wrong one like <b>Video Decoder<b> which should be fixed shortly before the .ts files get regenerated next time, it has been forgotten recently) please preserve the markup.
When translating (0 track(s)) as (0 дорожка/-ек), the lenght of the string grows from 15 to 18 characters. This may result in increased width of the codec widget, pushing the right edge of the video out of sight (maybe this issue will get properly fixed later, but this is what the things look like now). I'd suggest dropping leading spaces to reduce the string length.

Thank you for the very detailed answer. I'm not even software engineer, but I'll try to take all the critics into consideration.
By the way, could you tell me how to clone this commit for fixing? I know only how to clone all the git repository.

I'm not a software engineer either and even new to GitHub :-) The cleanest way to handle the situation would be to save the patch locally, cancel the pull request, undo the commit e.g. by
git push origin +1318829e3c4e2391410a1704bdb874008e75d0b6:master
then create a new branch (e.g. i18n-ru-updates) followed by
git checkout i18n-ru-updates
apply your patch to the branch, make any corrections you like. Once you are all set, push the branch to your GitHub repository and open a new pull request from that branch. It means, never work on master, always on a branch.
edit: To download your commit as a patch, use https://github.com/TotalCaesar659/avidemux2/commit/3c77efa2f49837932e21db82073652c34ed7423b.patch
Thanks, but it would be better to re-create this PR. I'll close this one and pull updated translation at the next time.

column13: [Pref] Return false if loading config fails, avoid selecting dummy audio device in this case
column20:
preferences::load returning true on error deserializing prefs struct led to "Dummy" audio device being selected if new preference settings were added or old ones removed, because setPrefsDefault() was not run within startAvidemux function in avidemux/common/main.cpp in this case.
Reference: No sound during playback of any video file using latest version of Avidemux
column21:
preferences::load returning true on error deserializing prefs struct led to "Dummy" audio device being selected if new preference settings were added or old ones removed, because setPrefsDefault() was not run within startAvidemux function in avidemux/common/main.cpp in this case.
Reference: No sound during playback of any video file using latest version of Avidemux

column13: Fix compilation on 32 bit Linux, fix the script to build and install Avidemux on Ubuntu
column20:
This pull request includes the following:


A build quirk for lavcodec based audio encoder plugins which adds "-lc" to linker flags via avidemux_plugins/ADM_audioEncoders/lavcodec/CMakeLists.txt if AE_LAVCODEC_BUILD_QUIRK cmake variable is set. The variable gets set in the Process() function from bootStrap.bash if uname -m returns something like i686.


A fix for the createDebFromSourceUbuntu.bash script, which now won't try to build Avidemux if installing build dependencies fails. The list of the dependencies has been reworked, adding missing build-critical libqt5opengl5-dev and non-critical but useful libva-dev. The Installation of libx265-dev is now separated from other packages because this package is not officially provided for Ubuntu 14.04.x and results otherwise in the installation of build dependencies failing alltogether.


My apologies for an unrelated trivial fix for tree PRIu32 macros in avidemux_plugins/ADM_audioEncoders/twolame/audioencoder_twolame.cpp missing a space causing compiler warnings that has slipped in. There are many more similar spots in the code which should be probalby addressed together, but I realized this already after committing this one, and it would be too cumbersome to clean the pull request from this patch.
column21:
This pull request includes the following:


A build quirk for lavcodec based audio encoder plugins which adds "-lc" to linker flags via avidemux_plugins/ADM_audioEncoders/lavcodec/CMakeLists.txt if AE_LAVCODEC_BUILD_QUIRK cmake variable is set. The variable gets set in the Process() function from bootStrap.bash if uname -m returns something like i686.


A fix for the createDebFromSourceUbuntu.bash script, which now won't try to build Avidemux if installing build dependencies fails. The list of the dependencies has been reworked, adding missing build-critical libqt5opengl5-dev and non-critical but useful libva-dev. The Installation of libx265-dev is now separated from other packages because this package is not officially provided for Ubuntu 14.04.x and results otherwise in the installation of build dependencies failing alltogether.


My apologies for an unrelated trivial fix for tree PRIu32 macros in avidemux_plugins/ADM_audioEncoders/twolame/audioencoder_twolame.cpp missing a space causing compiler warnings that has slipped in. There are many more similar spots in the code which should be probalby addressed together, but I realized this already after committing this one, and it would be too cumbersome to clean the pull request from this patch.

column13: [Qt/x265] Limit the number of ref frames in compliance with HEVC specs
column20:
Allowing users to increase the number of ref frames up to 16 and then rejecting the codec setup with an error message which doesn't mention the true reason why it appears is a bad idea. Enforce the HEVC specs compliance in the dialog to avoid user confusion.
Reference: settting X265 to more than 6 ref frames hass error.

column13: [x265] Use utf8 for filenames on Windows too
column20:
This fixes 2-pass encoding in HEVC failing on Windows when the specified filename contains diacritics or other non-ASCII characters. The patch is exactly the same solution as used in the x264 encoder.
Reference: x265 pass 2 failure

The problem is that the matching win32/win64 libx265 binary must support utf8
Which is not the case as far as i can see it
the version used at the moment is too old

column13: [Build] Add options to Ubuntu build script
[core/prefs] Accept too long or incomplete partial parameter lists
column20: Ignoring the return value of ADM_paramValidatePartialList prevents Avidemux from unnecessarily discarding configuration on version update. According to my testing with added or removed entries in config3 this is reasonably safe (the only crash I experienced – unrecoverable without fixing or deleting the config3 file manually  – happens independently of this patch). Type validation is provided to some degree within the ADM_paramLoadInternal function.

column20:
The following patches add a bash script based on the current bootStrapCrossMingw_w32Qt5_mxe.sh and bootStrap.bash to automate cross-compiling of Avidemux for Windows and to collect all required libs together with the fontconfig configuration (unsure if the latter is needed, but official nightlies include it). They add also a brief how-to describing the setup of the MXE cross-compile environment.
The script adds many options from bootStrap.bash like partial builds and doesn't use any scripts from the foreignBuilds directory. Creation of debug builds is not yet implemented, I was unsure whether this functionality would be useful. Some libs and binaries like twolame, aften, vapoursynth and avsproxy are not yet available in my MXE setup.
Cross-compiling using the default MXE qt5 package requires a tweak to some include paths in cmake/admCheckQt5.cmake, the first of the patches introduces a TYPE2_CROSS_SETUP cmake env variable to avoid breaking your own setup.
Due to the build of the bundled libass failing with mingw (it looks like [Plugin] Fix build with rasterizer file. The fix is bad, the difference is not linked to clang but to a difference on the build node. it will do for now doesn't work in MXE), I would like to upstream a modified rpmfusion.org patch to allow linking against system libass, liba52 and libmad as an option. The patch doesn't change any defaults; Avidemux still builds fine with internal libs.

column13: [Qt] Align the mute button and the volume slider, avoid clipping
column20:
Currently the top edge of the mute button gets clipped with the "fusion" Qt theme, the spacer results in a much too big distance between the button and the slider and the button and the slider are not aligned:

This patch centers the button and the slider horizontally and gets rid of the spacer and zero top margin for the button, avoiding clipping:

Tested WFM on Windows as well.

column13: [Qt] Reduce the minimum width of the selection widget
column20:
As evident from screenshots in #54, the width of the selection widget is excessive, wasting space to the left of the volume widget. With the proposed change it would look as follows with the "fusion" Qt theme (tested with "gtk" and "adwaita" as well):

One caveat: I can't test how it looks in HiDPI conditions, but I hope that dropping fixed width would only improve its behaviour.
edit: Actually, the patch reduces also the minimum height, which looked excessive too.

column13: [i18n/de/ru] Add kb accels to the audio track dialog, add a missing translation and fix agreement in i18n/ru
column20:
After the recent update of the Russian translation a month ago, some obvious omissions from that update still remain uncorrected, so I hope that this is not too inappropriate to address the most visible one

myself. The translation for "Track 1" was missing, causing misalignment, and the literal translation of "Enabled" as "Включено" (neuter) didn't match the gender of the translation for "Track" as "Дорожка" (feminine).
Using this opportunity, I would like to add keyboard accelerators in the German and in the Russian translation of the audio track selection dialog and to fix a single, broken keyboard accelerator in the German translation of the x265 configuration dialog.
column21:

Using this opportunity, I would like to add keyboard accelerators in the German and in the Russian translation of the audio track selection dialog and to fix a single, broken keyboard accelerator in the German translation of the x265 configuration dialog.

column13: [Qt] Take actual dimensions of widgets into account when resizing the main window
column20:
This allows to deal with different widget configurations and different font sizes, fixing too wide margins on Windows at the default font size.
The reason why an extra width of ~6px is necessary if the codec widget is visible, is not understood yet. Apart from that, the result is almost pixel-perfect. Tested with the fusion, gtk and adwaita Qt themes on Linux and with the default Qt theme on Windows.

column13: [flyDialog] Fix navigation slider (WIP), add missing tooltips
column20:
This patch should fix wrong scaling by setting maximum value for the slider straight away in the constructor and make the slider approximately reflect the current position, albeit not during playback. It also adds missing tooltips to the navigation buttons.
There is a not yet understood disagreement between the slider value from sliderGet immediately after drag and after nextImage, the slider jumps slightly backwards.
The total duration accessed as _in->getInfo()->totalDuration is not updated if the changeFps filter is added. This might be an issue with underlying code and not the preview dialog's fault.

column13: [UI] Preserve audio codec upon loading a video, now for real
column20:
My earlier naive attempt to preserve audio codec at least for the first track across videos has only led to a disagreement between the codec widget in the main window and the audio tracks menu as noticed by users: 
Encodage audio non sollicité mais automatique, Audio options not remembered in 2.6.17-18. This quick and dirty patch fixes the disagreement, really restoring the previously selected audio codec for the first audio track.
The audio codec reverts to "copy" upon loading a new video if "load default settings" is checked.
column21:

The audio codec reverts to "copy" upon loading a new video if "load default settings" is checked.

column20:
Maybe I'm missing something, but the time display (labelTime) added in [flyDialog] more accurate timestamps + display pts doesn't get updated in the most cases when navigating in a filter preview because nextImage() gets called only when clicking the "Next" button. I guess setting the text of the label belongs into nextImageInternal().
Currently, adding time display to flyDialog results in duplicated time display in the seekable preview, where the new time display looks a bit out of place.

column13: [Qt/contrast] Make dial titles translatable, avoid shifting widgets when turning dials
column20:
As shown in Jan's video in his Spoiler alert post, the transition between two and three digits for the contrast percentage or positive and negative values for brightness shifts other widgets in the contrast dialog if the font size is large enough for the labels to exceed the default width of the dials (100px). Avoid this by specifying for each label a minimum width derived from the longest string this label can contain.
On this occasion, make the labels translatable.
column21:

Avoid this by specifying for each label a minimum width derived from the longest string this label can contain.
On this occasion, make the labels translatable.

column20: Replacing nextImageInternal() in ADM_flyDialog::timeout by nextImage() which updates the slider position is everything it needs to make the slider move during playback. The call to updateSlider() in ADM_flyDialog::play was my mistake and should be removed.

Thanks that was the code i was looking for so new i can update the ts file my self it seems... even though i can't build Avidemux on Debian som easily because of dependencies problems.
I will submit a new updated translation in a while and tells see if everything is good.

I don't know what to do what the conclicts and why there are conflicts.
What is correct way to fix this?

As explained above, I had already included your translation updates in my commit added to #81, you'll have to close this pull request, unfortunately. Next time please fetch the git master and merge it into the branch you are working on first (with correctly set upstream, this amounts to
git fetch upstream master
git merge upstream/master

in your local git repository), then add your translations, commit the changes made to avidemux/qt4/i18n/avidemux_da.ts and push this branch to your fork on GitHub. After that you would be able to open a new pull request usually without conflicts.
We can continue How to update translation to sort out build issues (last time it was a version dependency conflict in packages hosted by the debian-multimedia repository).

If you are short of time to address the request to exclude merges from pull requests and to remove translations which doesn't alter the source, I could submit your update myself from the branch https://github.com/eumagga0x2a/avidemux2/tree/i18n-da-scootergrisen-cleanup – or you could take the patch from there, make a clean clone of the current mean00's avidemux2 git master, create a branch for your changes, checkout that branch, apply the patch and submit the pull request from this new branch yourself.
Fine, I'll prepare and submit a small pull request just for these two details once the current PR gets merged. Please keep up the good work!
Thanks, I'll do it when I have free time.

column13: [i18n/ru] Correct a few translation, add kbd accels, remove a lot of broken lrelease heuristic leftovers
column20:
This patch addresses a few issues mentioned in #84 (mainly correcting the usage of the word "граница" as translation for "border" as agreed with the translator), removes a ton of missed leftovers caused by the broken lrelease heuristic (they all originate from the time prior to the fix) and adds a few keyboard accelerators.
Please note that adding the "hue" filter crashes Avidemux without a usable backtrace when LANG is set to ru_RU.UTF-8 at least on Linux. This crash doesn't happen e.g. with the English or German locale. Deleting avidemux_ru.qm helps. The first bad commit seems to be Updated Russian translation. I haven't found the direct cause yet, so this patch doesn't address the crash.

column13: [core, qt] Use the base name of the currently loaded video as the default base name when saving
column20:
The currently existing implementation uses the name of the last file opened via file picker to build the suggested base name of the output video. This is not desirable because a video may be loaded via the "Recent" menu instead.
The patch removes also a forgotten unused leftover of [qt4] Provide a default filename when saving and corrects the behaviour if no video has been saved yet and thus LASTFILES_LASTDIR_WRITE is empty: in this case LASTFILES_LASTDIR_READ is used instead of suggesting an empty string as file name for the output.
Reference: Naming of saved files

column13: [UI] Resize the main window on unmaximizing
column20: If a new video was loaded or the zoom was changed while the Avidemux window was maximized, unmaximizing the window would restore its size prior to entering the maximized state regardless the actual dimensions of the video. This patch implements automatic resizing in this case.
column21: If a new video was loaded or the zoom was changed while the Avidemux window was maximized, unmaximizing the window would restore its size prior to entering the maximized state regardless the actual dimensions of the video. This patch implements automatic resizing in this case.

column20:
vdpauGetFormat accepts WMV3 as supported by hardware (vdpauinfo doesn't list WMV3 as supported, but mpv claims decoding .wmv videos via VDPAU and plays them perfectly), but decoderFFVDPAU knows nothing about that resulting in a crash.
It is worth noting that WMV is almost completely broken and unusable in Avidemux, no matter which decoder.
column21:
vdpauGetFormat accepts WMV3 as supported by hardware (vdpauinfo doesn't list WMV3 as supported, but mpv claims decoding .wmv videos via VDPAU and plays them perfectly), but decoderFFVDPAU knows nothing about that resulting in a crash.
It is worth noting that WMV is almost completely broken and unusable in Avidemux, no matter which decoder.

column13: [mixDump] Print a newline at the end, remove workarounds all over the tree
column20: Since ADM_info and ADM_warning print timestamps, the result of a lot of workarounds for missing newline at the end of mixDump output where ADM_info("\n"); is used instead looks very wrong. This patch adds the final newline to mixDump itself and removes all active (not commented out and not hidden in leftovers like *.orig files in avidemux_plugins/ADM_demuxers/Mp4 directory) workarounds across the tree.

column20:
AppData is a standard to describe GUI applications. In particular, it allows these applications to be searched for and installed through software centers on Fedora, Ubuntu, etc.
This commit embeds a .appdata.xml file for Avidemux, so my grandmother can install it without having to open a terminal.
For further information on AppData see:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/appstream/docs/chap-Quickstart.html#sect-Quickstart-DesktopApps
Related to: rpmfusion/avidemux#6

column13: [cosmetics] Add newline after fourcc::print at some locations
column20:
This is merely a cosmetic change improving legibility of debug output, which suffers from a few missing (or excessive) newlines mostly but not exclusively in connection with usage of fourcc::print function.
There are some spots in the (mostly debug) code which rely on fourcc::print not including a final newline thus preventing a more straightforward approach which would allow to scrap a lot of printf("\n"); all over the tree.

column13: [encoding] Use encoding dialog for the first pass (no re-use yet)
column20:
This patch falls way short of the goal to use the single instance of the encoding dialog for both the first and the second pass. It just replaces the working dialog with the encoding one for the first pass with related additional tweaks like disabling the "Advanced" tab and making information about remaining time available. The benefit: it is now possible to minimize Avidemux to the notification area during the first pass too (see reference). Without re-use of the dialog instance, the application window will pop up after the first pass though.
The patch makes also the "Pass 1" translatable and hides the disfunctional shutdown checkbox and priority  combo – on Linux and Mac completely, on Windows only for the first pass. The name of the priority label is changed to clarify its purpose when used in code elsewhere.
Automatic shutdown after  encoding can't work now, of course, as the value of shutdownRequired is not evaluated in the destructor and ADM_shutdown is never called. IMVHO, this functionality should be either fixed or the checkbox removed / hidden to avoid user confusion.

column21:
I hope it is tolerable to bundle both unrelated commits improving merely the legibility and the visuals of the console output in a single pull request. The second patch addresses the issue with ADM_{info,warning,error} adding a space character to the buffer. Present since [Core] Add colored funcs ADM_warning, ADM_info and ADM_error, it resulted in the space character being printed past the closing newline at the line with the following message, destroying alignment.
The most confusing effect: run avidemux3_qt5 from terminal and close the Avidemux window via Alt+F4. The last message (usually from abortExitHandler) in terminal is formatted with ADM_info resulting in the prompt being pushed one column to the right. Now scroll through the command history list: the space between the prompt and following command in the console is gone.

column13: [encoding] Move pass 1 encoding dialog to muxer, reuse it for pass 2
column20:
This patch circumvents difficulties of sharing the encoding dialog between different parts of the application by managing it solely from the core muxer and also cleans up a few includes.
Now it is possible to send Avidemux during the first pass to tray and it will stay there until the second pass is completed.

column20: This is an experimental and incomplete minimally invasive patch to add optional laptop-friendly keyboard shortcuts. It doesn't address hardcoded tooltips in the navigation widget yet. Toggling the preference requires a restart of Avidemux for the changes to take effect.
column21:
If we go down that road, why no make these configurable ?
i.e. each is a triplet
Description / Actual Key / display shortcut

I fear I don't quite get the idea. Would you prefer making every single shortcut a pref? Or every alternative shortcut a pref? Prefs expect value pairs (like Action:shortCut, so this is OK). There is no GUI to set them yet, encouraging users to edit config3 manually is probably the easiest way to get into trouble. Only a small subset of shortcuts raises a controversy, this is why I wanted to avoid to touch the MenuEntry struct and myMenu{Edit,Go} vectors.
My immediate goal was to produce a cheap stop-gap solution (i.e. something still doable with my limited skills) to address usability issues with laptop keyboards. Qt allows to assign multiple shortcuts to an action, which I investigated and got basically working, but backed off from that path because of poor discoverability of secondary shortcuts.

Will this take care of bringing back [ and ] ?

If we end up with user configurable keyboard shortcuts, you'll be able to assign these keys (which are horribly inconvenient on non-US keyboards and completely absent in some Russian layouts). The current patch suggests I and O for that.

column21:
Basically enhance your patch by making it configurable
The default keys stays the same, but you can set an alternate shortcut, which is as below by default
and that you can reset
That way, even if you have US/russian/German keyboard and using desktop/laptop keyboard
everybody can tune it as it pleases
The pref would be a int, -1 would mean default, else the key to use
It's just that there will always be someone with a special keyboard/language that will be unhappy if not done that way
That would end up as
ACT_PREF_ALT_MARKA = 'I'
ACT_PREF_ALT_MARKB = -1 (default)
etc etc
This would then be constructed dynamically, no problem
That's why it's done that way, instead of relying to  Qt menu management
static const kbdAccel _extraKbdAccels[] = {


       {ACT_MarkA,        "I"},



       {ACT_MarkB,        "O"},



       {ACT_ResetMarkers, "R"},



       {ACT_GotoMarkA,    "A"},



       {ACT_GotoMarkB,    "B"},



       {ACT_Begin,        "H"},



       {ACT_End,          "E"}



   };

column13: [UI] Enable or disable menu items dynamically
column20:
This patch cleans up the undo queue a bit, getting rid of global variables and providing necessary helper functions used to determine whether a particular menu item should be enabled or disabled. Disabling e.g. the items in the "Auto" menu avoids Avidemux crashing when selecting any of the items without a video loaded.
Disabling the "Save as Image" submenu instead of the submenu actions is clumsy, but I haven't found a solution for that during the time available.

column13: [Qt] Remove the now redundant call to buildActionLists() in the MainWindow constructor
[Qt] Set lastdir_read on drag'n'drop as well
column20:
This patch addresses the following bugreport by acritum.
The reason the issue is solved in Qt GUI instead of in the common Avidemux code is that managing lastdir_read in a centralised way in A_openVideo or in A_appendVideo while looking much more logical would result in an IMHO problematic behaviour when keeping project files and source videos in different locations: instead of opening the most recently used folder with project files, the file selection dialog would always open the folder with the last source video loaded or appended.
Loading a video via command line or ShellExecute won't update lastdir_read.
column21:
This patch addresses the following bugreport by acritum.
The reason the issue is solved in Qt GUI instead of in the common Avidemux code is that managing lastdir_read in a centralised way in A_openVideo or in A_appendVideo while looking much more logical would result in an IMHO problematic behaviour when keeping project files and source videos in different locations: instead of opening the most recently used folder with project files, the file selection dialog would always open the folder with the last source video loaded or appended.
Loading a video via command line or ShellExecute won't update lastdir_read.

column13: [UI/Qt] Hide non-functional volume widget with PulseAudioSimple
column20:
On Linux, we default to PulseAudioSimple output, which doesn't support volume control. Showing users a non-operational volume slider may be confusing, hide the volume widget if PulseAudioSimple is selected.
Furthermore, reinterpret UI_updateActionShortcut as the general way to perform actions on saving preferences, rename in to UI_applySettings.
column21:

column13: [ae_lavc] Fix max bitrate for mp2 and ac3
column20: Currently, the configuration dialog suggests illegal max. bitrate of 448kbps for the mp2 lavc encoder, which gets later rejected by FFmpeg. column21:
This one could be controversial because tooltips become the only way to access long filter descriptions which get cut off.
Enabling word wrap for labels doesn't work well for me because list items must be 4 lines high to accomodate some translations inc. the German one while QFontMetrics::elidedText fails to take <small> tags into account.
The following screenshots show the rendering issue.

column13: [Qt/mainfilter] Disable horizontal scrolling to work around rendering issues

intent of using the provided value of *port at all (even in the log message
before binding). Is it ever initialized? Anyhow, knowledgeable people
should figure out the correct thing to do quickly. I don't mind if you discard
this dirty pull request as long as the proper fix goes in;-)

column21: Ah, you're quick. I don't mind the fix either way. I did not test mean00's fix yet, but I suppose it has the same effect for the code path that affected my use case. My only gripe is that the comments in the function should be fixed, as they claim it always uses an arbitrary port assigned by the OS when in fact it relies on you initializing the port parameter accordingly.

column21:
OK, tested it. Seems fine. So we can close this pull request. I still suggest changing the
documentation for the function to indicate that ‘any port’ does not mean that the
port parameter is output only. Forgetting to initialize it could happen again.
thx

Thank you. FYI, translation files will be updated shortly before the next release, there have been some changes in the code affecting translatable strings, e. g. the "Play filtered" checkbox has been turned into an action and lives now in the toolbar and in the "Video" menu. Current translation files don't reflect these changes yet.

column20:
avsfilter does not work after wine git commit:
f16cf541068831074a6891688d947f0ce32abdd9 (kernel32: GetTempPathW must zero the remaining buffer.)
GetTempPathW receives size in bytes from wine_tmp_path, but it expects size in wchars.
GetTempPathW (wine source dlls/kernel32/path.c) crashes in line:
memset(path + ret, 0, (count - ret) * sizeof(WCHAR));
because of wrong count value.

column21: Thank you for your report, I agree that this behavior is confusing. However, the proposed patch won't help if the video has been played before maximizing the window. I'm going to fix it in changeEvent().

Thank you.
By the way, it looks like initializing ignoreResizeEvent to false true is not required anymore, so changing it to true would be at least harmless. It was a remnant of an early attempt to prevent small videos from being automatically upscaled when loaded. The issue was fixed by the part of [GUI] Fix small videos changing zoom to fit into window on stopping playback which set ignoreResizeEvent to false true at the end of MainWindow::setMenuItemsEnabledState.

column21: The upstream .desktop file was outdated and unused since the GTK GUI had been abandoned. People who packaged Avidemux for Linux distributions wrote their own .desktop files for avidemux3_qt*.

Since a few months, Avidemux uses updated high-resolution application icons on Windows and macOS, albeit not on Linux (the problem was creating satisfactory low-resolution versions). I am not sure the Linux version should choose a totally different color palette and design language – so we need either to create a set of icons in usual sizes (16, 22, 24, 32, 48, 256) matching to some extent the appearance on other platforms or redo the application icons on Windows and macOS.
Are they in the repository? I can't find them.

The macOS icons file was last touched in [macOS] Fix wrong inclination of stripes on the clapperboard in the application icon.
The high-resolution icon for Windows was added by [Windows] Add high resolution, PNG compressed bitmap to the application icon. The original SVG files which were used to produce the graphics are not in the repository.
Linux supports SVG icons, so please could you add them? Or at least a PNG? (I would prefer the macOS version for Linux)
ping?

A set of new Avidemux icons for Linux is definitely on radar but not a priority ATM. The hard part is designing low resolution and symbolic (monochrome) versions. Once this is accomplished and lands in a release, adding the source SVG might be reconsidered.
Personally, I am happy with Icon=org.gnome.Totem and StartupWMClass=avidemux3_qt5 in the Avidemux .desktop file as a private temporary solution.
What concerns the proposed icon, thank you very much, but we won't take it upstream.

What concerns the proposed icon, thank you very much, but we won't take it upstream.

Of course, I'm not asking you to do that, now that you shown that there already better ones available. Why can't you just replace the one at the top level with the macos icon?

Why can't you just replace the one at the top level with the macos icon?

Because the macOS icon is just for macOS, it doesn't fit into other environments and visual styles.

Because the macOS icon is just for macOS, it doesn't fit into other environments and visual styles.

This might be the case, but the icon is definitely much better than the one that is at the top level at the moment.
thx

column21:
The structure ADM_videoEncoderDesc is defined in avidemux_core/ADM_coreVideoEncoder/include/ADM_coreVideoEncoderInternal.h, so the first member is the codec tag, which must be unique and is how a codec must be called in scripts. This means, we can't make the tag translatable, otherwise scripts would need to be rewritten for each locale which provides a translation.
The second member is what gets shown in the menu. Frankly speaking, even if it works, I don't like the idea to make codec names translatable (don't forget all the other codecs in avidemux_plugins/ADM_videoEncoder). Apart from making user support harder, it would result in the menu being sorted differently in each locale.
The real issue is that we have that default text in gui2.ui which lands in translation files and seduces translators to translate what doesn't need to be translated at all, while we can't add a comment to warn them.

update

Users who want to use custom (like old style) shortcuts are supposed to enable alternative shortcuts in Avidemux preferences and to edit their config3 file, i.e. in your case to modify the part
         "keyboard_shortcuts" : {
                "use_alternate_kbd_shortcuts" : true,
                "swap_up_down_keys" : false,
                "alt_mark_a" : "I",
                "alt_mark_b" : "O",
                "alt_reset_markers" : "R",
                "alt_goto_mark_a" : "A",
                "alt_goto_mark_b" : "B",
                "alt_begin" : "S",
                "alt_end" : "E"
         },

to get
         "keyboard_shortcuts" : {
                "use_alternate_kbd_shortcuts" : true,
                "swap_up_down_keys" : false,
                "alt_mark_a" : "[",
                "alt_mark_b" : "]",
                "alt_reset_markers" : "R",
                "alt_goto_mark_a" : "A",
                "alt_goto_mark_b" : "B",
                "alt_begin" : "S",
                "alt_end" : "E"
         },

Contributions implementing a GUI for modifying custom shortcuts warmly welcome. The default shortcuts are not going to change.

Would you update the release entry in appdata.xml, whenever you make new releases?
It would be also nice, if you could make a new release soon. I would like to update the flatpak (https://flathub.org/apps/details/org.avidemux.Avidemux) with Qt 5.12 support and these metadata fixes.

Thank you very much. We have a small problem that the patch has been created based on git master. However, the current work is done on the ffmpeg4x branch which contains updated translation files. Would it be doable for you to resubmit this translation update based on the ffmpeg4x branch instead of master?
If this is too complicated, I could try to pull it and see whether I manage to resolve resulting merge conflicts when merging master into ffmpeg4x.

Trying to merge files may be a bad idea. You have cleared the file from old translations, so the new one is much smaller (about 200k).
I'll use the dictionary from the old file and prepare a new one.

You have cleared the file from old translations, so the new one is much smaller

Not just that. Recent modificatons of the subtitle plugin required manual interventions to preserve existing translations despite source string changes.

I'll use the dictionary from the old file and prepare a new one.

This would be very nice, thank you.

I noticed that you modified the qtbase translation as well. These translations are grabbed from qt upstream once Qt in our build nodes is updated. It would be far better to submit the changes upstream as downstream changes would get lost in the course of the next update.
If the work on the ffmpeg4x version of the patch for avidemux_pl.ts hasn't progressed much yet, I would merge this into master and deal with merge conflicts when merging master into ffmpeg4x like in the case of the Greek translation update as the beta release is imminent.
Merging, thank you for your contribution.

This is too complicated for me. I'll deal with qtbase problem later.
Second, more important thing. Are you suggesting that I should not update the translation and wait until you have merged the branches? I got lost a bit and I do not know what to do.

Everything is already accomplished, thank you. The pull request has been merged into master and master pro forma merged* into ffmpeg4x which is the current beta release branch for 64 bits builds for Linux, macOS and Windows 7+.
The updated avidemux_pl.ts from ffmpeg4x has been subsequently copied over to the legacy-compat branch which is the source of 32 bits builds trying to keep compatibility with Windows XP (which refuses to die).
*) I simply applied the patch to ffmpeg4x branch and let git figure out the diff necessary to resolve the conflict.
Regarding qtbase translations, it would be better to submit patches where these files come from – https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qttranslations.git/ –  following https://wiki.qt.io/Qt_Localization because any modifications to these files in the Avidemux codebase will be overwritten when the translations get refreshed (copied over from upstream).
I apologize for an accidental mixup of English and German while writing "Polish" in two of my last commits on the ffmpeg4x and legacy-compat branches.

column20:
Currently the Avidemux .desktop file doesn't enable Avidemux to open files directly from the file manager. Nor can it be set as the default application for opening a filetype, even the ones it supports.
This is due to the lack of a %f placeholder on the Exec= line of the .desktop file. The placeholder is replaced with the filename of the single file to be opened, and if it's not present, GNOME Shell and possibly other environments won't consider an application as having the ability to directly open files.
(I didn't use the %F multi-file placeholder because in my testing, attempting to open multiple files  with Avidemux doesn't work. Any additional files listed on the command line after the first are simply ignored, not appended.)
With this change, Avidemux appears in the 'Open file with...' list in GNOME Shell, and it can be set as the default application for any of the filetypes listed in its MimeTypes= list.
column21:
Currently the Avidemux .desktop file doesn't enable Avidemux to open files directly from the file manager. Nor can it be set as the default application for opening a filetype, even the ones it supports.
This is due to the lack of a %f placeholder on the Exec= line of the .desktop file. The placeholder is replaced with the filename of the single file to be opened, and if it's not present, GNOME Shell and possibly other environments won't consider an application as having the ability to directly open files.
(I didn't use the %F multi-file placeholder because in my testing, attempting to open multiple files  with Avidemux doesn't work. Any additional files listed on the command line after the first are simply ignored, not appended.)
With this change, Avidemux appears in the 'Open file with...' list in GNOME Shell, and it can be set as the default application for any of the filetypes listed in its MimeTypes= list.

column13: add support for alternate key for Delete action
add support for alternate key for Delete action
column21:
Thank you, the changes as such look great, and yes, all the magic numbers in menu action enabling / disabling code is an unmanageable hell in need for an urgent fix.
When merged, the patch will finally solve the problem on OSes other than macOS with keyboards without a Delete key. In return, it will require users to edit the configuration file (config3) to keep their physical Delete key (or the Backspace key on macOS) working as expected while enjoying the comfort of alternative keyboard shortcuts.
Would you please agree to set the default alternative shortcut for delete instead of to "K" to the current normal default value? This will allow all users who need to work around a hardware limitation or want to use a custom shortcut like "K" to accomplish it while letting the majority (IMVHO) unaffected.

I fear there is simply no style consistency in vast areas of the historically grown codebase whatsoever. On my part, I just try to keep content and extensive whitespace / style changes separate, if possible.
For new code which doesn't mean to blend into close environment, tabs are not used, scope levels are idented by 4 spaces and the opening curly bracket is placed on a new line. I am not sure there is much else left in the sense of visual style.

column20:
Add the ability to select the color primaries, color matrix, and transfer characteristics.  This was already in the Output 2 tab, but was disabled and never completed.
This will only be added to the bitstream if any of options are changed from "Unknown".
I've tried to sort the available options in a useful and consistent way and also indicate what kind of material will use them.  "Unknown" is translatable, but the other items aren't.  I omitted the reserved codes.
The UI is reorganized significantly for this.  Create new tab "Display" and put the PAR and color options here.  Then combine what was left of the Output 1 and Output 2 tabs into one Output tab.  That tab remains disabled.  The Video Format combo box also remains disabled on the Display tab.
Fix the PAR options so that selecting unspecified will leave the PAR unspecified, predefined will select one of the H.265 predefined SAR codes, and custom will select an extended SAR.
The predefined aspect ratios are now the ones defined in H.265.  The PAR values previously in the combo box are not in the standard and they are (arguably) incorrect.
I've tested with ffprobe -show_stream and it finds the indicated color information.  The PAR values work too, but will come from the container first, and only if no container is used, from the video stream.

Great, thank you very much for this contribution.

The predefined aspect ratios are now the ones defined in H.265. The PAR values previously in the combo box are not in the standard and they are (arguably) incorrect.

The PAR values for PAL in x265_sar_names are unfortunately wrong for the vast majority of SD broadcasts and video DVD sources at least in Germany where the 720x576 resolution is predominantly used. No deal breaker anyway.
How does the added support for color primaries, matrices and transfer characteristics in the x265 plugin correspond to the current state of (in)ability to handle these (especially sorely lacking in case of BT.2020) in Avidemux? Does it depend on internal color handling in Avidemux getting fixed / redesigned to become really useful?

column21:
The PARs of 12:11 or 16:11 are correct for 720x576.  The width of 720 includes overscan.  The displayed width, the part of the screen which should make up the 4:3 or 16:9 image, is only ~704 of those pixels.
This can been seen in the H263, H264, and H265 specs, where the PAR 12:11 example is 720x576 with overscan, and the 24:12 example is the 352x576 without overscan.
The analog outputs of DVD players would almost always get this correct, with 704 and 720 width DVDs having the same PAR and 720 width DVDs having effectively 16 pixel wider image.
Digital display of DVDs was quite often wrong, treating the 720 width image as having no overscan and producing the incorrect 16:15 and 64:45 PARs.
If the source was originally analog video, then 16:15 is almost certainly wrong and 12:11 is correct.
But if someone scaled down a bluray rip from 1080p to DVD res, then they probably took the entire 1920x1080 DAR 16:9 image and converted into into a 720x576 DAR 16:9 image with no overscan, and a PAR of 64:25 is correct.  They should have used 704x576, but of course 720 is more than 704 so no one does this.

column21:
My understand of the colorspace settings, is that as long as the re-encoding doesn't convert to YUV->RGB->YUV, and it shouldn't, then it will be ok if the correct output is chosen.  If I know my source if BT.709 and select BT.709 as the output, it should be correct.  If I select the wrong output colorspace, then it will be incorrect.
If a filter does a conversion to/from RGB, then it should use the color matrix values to do that correctly.  I'm doubt any of them do.  However, the display driver might support this!
My understanding is the color primaries and EOTF are ignored by anything one might use to display the video.  It's just information a profession film editor might use.  The color matrix value is used by better display devices and software.  Or it's ignored and width of the video is used to select SMPTE 170M or BT.709.

column13: Allow choice of executable in AppImage
column20:
Because of the patch with sed in deployBusterMinimal.sh, to replace all absolute paths to /usr by relative paths ././ and thelike, AppRunBuster has to change directory to "${HERE}/usr", which it indeed does. But then "$@" should be run through a loop to replace relative path or filename arguments in it by their "realpath".


The new AppImage runtime passes a variable ARGV0 to AppRun, which is set to the name/path used to execute the AppImage (for example the name of a symbolic link to the actual AppImage file). That way, if a user or his admin makes three symbolic links to the appImage file, let's say as avidemux, avidemux_jobs, and avidemux_cli (with or without versions in the name), the AppRun script can detect the suffix used, and call the corresponding binary.


This pull request should go with an instruction to the AppImage user, or his admin, to place symbolic links to the AppImage file. If the AppImage file is executed without symbolic link, avidemux3_qt5 is executed. If the symbolic link contains the substring "_jobs", avidemux3_jobs_qt5 is executed; else if the symbolic link contains the substring "_cli", avidemux3_cli is executed; else avidemux3_qt5 is executed.

If the AppImage file is executed without symbolic link, avidemux3_qt5 is executed. If the symbolic link contains the substring "_jobs", avidemux3_jobs_qt5 is executed; else if the symbolic link contains the substring "_cli", avidemux3_cli is executed; else avidemux3_qt5 is executed.
column21: Thanks a lot

column20:
The ts.idx2 file stores framerate as fps * 1000, instead of a rational
number with an integer number and denominator, which would be much
better.
It must then convert that back into a rational so it can put inside a
fake AVI header.
It does not use a closest rational approximation algorithm but just hard
codes a few different common frame rates.  And the standard ATSC rate of
60000/1001 was not in the list.  So add it.

column13: Increased editor cache size default and upper limit
column20:
Hi!
Editing high demanding contents (eg. 4k 60fps or more) is very painfull, especially when searching for cutting point in the video.
Due to the default (and until now upper limit) 16 frames editor cache size, while navigating in the video, it will constantly re decode the video frames, therefore it cause a major slowdown during editing.
In this commit i increased the upper limit to 255 frames, and the default value to 60 frames.

column13: Increased editor cache size default and upper limit
column20:
Hi!

column21:
Thank you, let us do some maths.
The minimum amount of memory necessary to store a 3840x2160 YUV picture with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling is 3840 * 2160 * 3 / 2 = 12441600 bytes.
With hardware acceleration enabled, 12441600 * 60 ≅ 712 MiB which the graphics card needs to be able to allocate in its memory available for video decoding acceleration (maybe it can use the entire graphics memory and swap into the main one, I don't know, this may depend on hardware, operating system, driver and driver settings).
With editor cache size at maximum, a graphics card needs to be able to provide almost 3 GiB of video decode acceleration memory.
Fianlly, we should not forget that this is per loaded video, i.e. appending a second video doubles the requirements.
How should this scale? My experience with hitting the ceiling of available video surfaces was not good so far. Actually, the current number of 16 pictures in cache is already pretty dangerous in absence of a safe and reliable way to detect the actual limit for the particular system (we should not forget that other applications may want to allocate some video surfaces as well).

column13: Crop filter keep aspect ratio option
column20:
Hi!
Added a "Keep aspect ratio" option to the Crop video filter.
When enabled, the aspect ratio of the source can be maintained on the selected crop area, if the rubber-band is dragged by the bottom-right corner. The top-left corner continue to be free dragging,the numeric inputs are unchanged.
(Use-case: recently i had to cut several scenes out of a video, and the areas of interest had different sizes and positions. )

column21:
Thank you, the assumption that the source already has the desired aspect ratio may not hold in real life, but that could be addressed later, maybe by adding a menu which would include also a set of pre-defined standard aspect ratios and an option to lock the current one.

The top-left corner continue to be free dragging,the numeric inputs are unchanged.

I understand that this allows to re-position the rubber band without disengaging the aspect ratio lock, but I don't like the UX, namely:

the bottom-right grip jumps away when dragged
spinboxes get out of sync with the rubber band
swapping checkbox description with a tooltip-style comment resizes the dialog when video width is small

I would love to pull the changes now and provisionally fix these issues myself at the cost of the top-left corner being disabled when the aspect ratio lock checkbox is checked. This will ensure that they make it into the 2.7.7 release.
Alternatively, I would return to this topic right after the release which is already greatly overdue.
Which option do you prefer?

column21:
MPlayer eq2: bugfix
I have just noticed, that the red and blue gamma sliders operate as them being swapped. It was fine in 2.7.6.
There was a bug in the processing code, the filters for the U and V planes was swapped. But it remained hidden in prev. versions.
As i suspect around commit 8864038 there was a corrective U-V plane swapping, and that brought out the problem.
swResize: improvement
The "Round to the Nearest Multiple of 16" checkbox has been replaced with a ComboBox. There are now multiple choices (none, 16, 8, 4).

column21:
Thank you, it would be great if you could provide isolated fixes for functional bugs you noticed. Anything else will need to wait until after release, with exception of the "Unknown parameter" checkbox, which really needs to get a correct description.
For example, fixing the string "HighQuality" in msharpen.ui invalidates 10 existing translations, which would be justified in other circumstances, but IMHO not now.
I would suggest a workflow of creating a feature branch for each topic and splitting large-scale changes in narrow-scoped commits. This would help a lot to understand the changes later. I would also ask to avoid including merge commits into PR when possible.
For these reasons I cannot pull this big one, unfortunately.

I have just noticed, that the red and blue gamma sliders operate as them being swapped. It was fine in 2.7.6.

Good catch! The meaning of PLANAR_U and PLANAR_V enumerators was unswapped recently in 3d57249 affecting all code matching anything to these enumerators.

The "Round to the Nearest Multiple of 16" checkbox has been replaced with a ComboBox. There are now multiple choices (none, 16, 8, 4).

The option to enforce rounding to a multiple of 16 in swResize is dictated by the nature of video compression, smaller values don't make much sense.

Yes, please, that would be lovely. If an example helps, please have a look at contributions by xyzzy42.
Multiple descriptions of the standard workflow exist, e.g. https://github.com/susam/gitpr or https://gist.github.com/Chaser324/ce0505fbed06b947d962

column13: ASharp valid range of spinboxes fixed, added sliders for convenience
column20:
The ranges of the spinboxes were 0 .. 99
According to [http://avisynth.nl/index.php/ASharp]:

Unsharp masking threshold range is from 0 to 32.
Adaptive sharpening strength must be between 0 and 16.
Block adaptive sharpening must be less than 4.
I double checked with the underlying code, i can confirm these ranges apply here too.

Added slider controls for the spinboxes for convenience (they are in sync with the spinboxes).
Changed "Unknown flag" to "High quality block filtering"

column13: [asharp/qt4] UI add checkboxes for proper enable/disable option
column20:
Backend code behaviour:

Adaptive strength is enabled when the D parameter > 0. Disabled if == 0.
Block adaptive sharpening is disabled ,when the B parameter is negative.

For clarity, checkboxes were added, to handle enabled/disabled states.
column21:

Adaptive strength is enabled when the D parameter > 0. Disabled if == 0.
Block adaptive sharpening is disabled ,when the B parameter is negative.

column13: [asharp/qt4] UI add checkboxes for proper enable/disable option
column20:

column21:
Thanks you, a toggle for block adaptive filtering definitely makes sense as there haven't been a way to disable it in the UI.
The effect of adaptive strength when disabled being identical when set to maximum is utterly confusing IMHO. Are you sure it is not a bug in Avidemux implementation? If not, I am really inclined to trick (i.e. allow 0 as parameter value, but internally translate it to a very small non-zero value depending on toggle state).
I feel that the state of toggles needs to be preserved across sessions, i.e. the set of parameters in asharp struct needs to be extended. I think also that it needs to be decoupled from spinboxes and sliders. It is fine to disable them when the corresponding checkbox is unchecked, but they need to preserve the value between sessions.

column13: [asharp/qt4] UI add checkboxes for proper enable/disable option
column20:
Backend code behaviour:

Adaptive strength is enabled when the D parameter > 0. Disabled if == 0.
Block adaptive sharpening is disabled ,when the B parameter is negative.

For clarity, checkboxes were added, to handle enabled/disabled states.
column21:
The effect of adaptive strength when disabled being identical when set to maximum

Actually it is not the same. When disabled, and threshold set to max, the macroblock and submacroblock boundaries can be seen (depending on the source), with enabled & max value they not. In the disabled case it is pure unsharp masking. When enbaled and set to max, it will still be adaptive.

Are you sure it is not a bug in Avidemux implementation?

As far as i can determine, it works same as in avisynth.
The toggle states and the corresponding numeric values are coupled in the current implementation, as the backend algorithm dictates.

It is fine to disable them when the corresponding checkbox is unchecked, but they need to preserve the value between sessions.

They are preserved, while configuring the filter (for user's convenience). Applying and closing the configurator, i can not see a reason why sould they be kept.

column21:
The effect of adaptive strength when disabled being identical when set to maximum

Actually it is not the same. When disabled, and threshold set to max, the macroblock and submacroblock boundaries can be seen (depending on the source), with enabled & max value they not. In the disabled case it is pure unsharp masking. When enbaled and set to max, it will still be adaptive.

Indeed, they looked the same only at the default threshold value. Thank you for pointing it out.

The toggle states and the corresponding numeric values are coupled in the current implementation, as the backend algorithm dictates.

I don't understand why the toggle for adaptive strength is needed then. Disabling by moving slider fully to the left is sufficient then (eventually with special value text added for clarification).


It is fine to disable them when the corresponding checkbox is unchecked, but they need to preserve the value between sessions.

They are preserved, while configuring the filter (for user's convenience). Applying and closing the configurator, i can not see a reason why sould they be kept.

The reason is that the user reopening the configuration dialog will find it in a different state than when closing = bad UX.

I don't understand why the toggle for adaptive strength is needed then. Disabling by moving slider fully to the left is sufficient then (eventually with special value text added for clarification).

I think its bad UX if you move the slider just a litle bit, and the result is drastically different. The spearate checkbox for enable/disable is more clean.

The reason is that the user reopening the configuration dialog will find it in a different state than when closing = bad UX.

I will indtroduce shadow parameters then.

column13: [asharp/qt4] UI add checkboxes for proper enable/disable option
column20:
Backend code behaviour:

Adaptive strength is enabled when the D parameter > 0. Disabled if == 0.
Block adaptive sharpening is disabled ,when the B parameter is negative.

For clarity, checkboxes were added, to handle enabled/disabled states.
column21:
I don't understand why the toggle for adaptive strength is needed then. Disabling by moving slider fully to the left is sufficient then (eventually with special value text added for clarification).

I think its bad UX if you move the slider just a litle bit, and the result is drastically different. The spearate checkbox for enable/disable is more clean.

I agree, the blame falls onto the developers of the original filter implementation, IMHO not suitable 1:1 for a GUI. This is why I would cheat here, keeping the checkbox and allowing zero in the spinbox, which will be translated to a very small non-zero value behind the curtains.
The checkbox will ensure that zero is passed to the algorithm when checked.


The reason is that the user reopening the configuration dialog will find it in a different state than when closing = bad UX.

I will indtroduce shadow parameters then.

column13: [security patch] use encrypted channel for update check
column20:
Hi!
The current update check use plain http to get the update info, which can be easily hijacked.
Assuming a hijacked connection, the cases i tested:

someone can inject malicious URL, that will popup on startup (inattentive/inexperienced users can be deceived)
memory overflow, which can lead to unusable/crashed system (swapping, OOM killer, etc...)
For example i fabricated a file with size around 5 GiB. In a minute (i have fiber :) ) the memory usage of avidemux was over 5 GiB.

If the avidemux.org server has limited resources, you can use github as for example:
https : // raw.githubusercontent.com/mean00/avidemux2/master/update/

column20:
Hi!
The current update check use plain http to get the update info, which can be easily hijacked.
Assuming a hijacked connection, the cases i tested:

someone can inject malicious URL, that will popup on startup (inattentive/inexperienced users can be deceived)

If the avidemux.org server has limited resources, you can use github as for example:
https : // raw.githubusercontent.com/mean00/avidemux2/master/update/
column21:
I am not associated with avidemux.org and I don't argue with the first point, but if DOS from memory exhaustion is a concern, shouldn't it be caught in ADMCheckUpdate::execute() e.g. with something like manager.head(request) and proceeding with manager.get(request) only if the size is within bounds?
I have no idea whether this is sufficient as protection – a malicious server could probably send different values for HEAD and GET. By all means, introducing an upper bound for ba.size() in ADMCheckUpdate::downloadFinished() wouldn't harm.
But shouldn't it all be handled by the maintainer of the project, should it?

Hi!

someone can inject malicious URL, that will popup on startup (inattentive/inexperienced users can be deceived)

For example i fabricated a file with size around 5 GiB. In a minute (i have fiber :) ) the memory usage of avidemux was over 5 GiB.

column21:
Other than this simple fix, this is deep water territory for me. However i am sure, at the point the process reaches ADMCheckUpdate::downloadFinished(), the large amount of received data is already in the memory.
IMHO using https and server with valid certificates is the proper and only sane solution.

column20:
This feature branch is the continuation of 73b5bdd (pending Pull Request #212)
Actually editing video, i was still unsatisfied with the crop filter, because repositioning the selection was hard.
Therefore added a drag mode, by replacing "Keep aspect" chechbox with a comboBox, which has:
-Free resize (this is the original mode)
-Free drag
-Keep aspect ratio
However there is a bug i cant figure out (i suspect, it is in the underlying rubber mechanism):
start dragging, the drag point (top-left corner) can not be dragged beyond the pivot point, determined by the bottom-right corner when drag started. The visible rubber band resizes (moves) as it suppose to do, but it acts as if it were a secondary but invisible rubber band, that dont.
Releasing the drag grip, the dragging can be continued, with the new pivot point.

column13: New video filter category + new filters
column20:
Created a new category "Artistic" in the video filter manager . The existing categories and filters are more or less technical in nature.
There are 3 kickoff filter:

Color effect (eg. sepia, old photo and more...). Ported (& extended) from frei0r framework (GPLv2)
Vignette (Lens vignetting effect). Ported (& improved) from frei0r framework (GPLv2)
Pixelize (pixelize with free PAR)

column21:
Thank you, a great effect indeed!

I wonder whether it is necessary to printString() "Processed" as there is no side-by-side comparison and therefore the picture must show the preview of output. This costs a little bit of performance, isn't it?
There is a usability problem with horizontalSliderUnSync: because of its huge range, it is difficult to use with mouse wheel, you have to scroll and scroll and scroll... and it hardly moves from the spot. It would be great to have this fixed.
I would suggest a distinct description for each checkbox (e.g. "No luma delay", "No chroma delay"). My first thought was a copy&paste error until I read the code.
It would be also great to declare all the stuff (myFly, canvas, ui) which doesn't necessarily need to be public in Ui_artVHSWindow as private or protected.

column20: Most authentic at lower resolutions (eg. 576p).
column21:
Great, almost there.
I've extended the functionality of ADM_SliderIndicator so that it can be used for horizontalSliderUnSync too, like
#define SPINNER(x,y) ui.horizontalSlider##x->setScale(1,y,2); \
        connect( ui.horizontalSlider##x,SIGNAL(valueChanged(int)),this,SLOT(valueChanged(int)));
        SPINNER(LumaBW,100)
        SPINNER(ChromaBW,100)
        SPINNER(UnSync,10)

Two small things I've missed last night: in flyArtVHS::download, I wonder whether the precision of MYSPIN(...)->value() / float; is lost, the integer might need an explicit cast to float here (if I am not mistaken, clang is very strict here, so the feature would be broken on macOS).
The other one is a bounds check missing in ADMVideoArtVHS::update, it is easy to make Avidemux crash in ArtVHSProcess_C with input values it doesn't like.

column20: Ported from MLT framework (LGPL/GPL).

column20: Ported from MLT framework (LGPL/GPL).
column21:
Thank you very much for proactively fixing issues.
I wonder whether the algorithm could be improved performance-wise? This filter is super-slow on my hardware, not reaching real-time even with 720p at 25fps. Maybe is multi-threading possible? I don't know.
I need to draw a line, else the release will never happen. I'll come back to this one once it is done.
PS + OT: If it might interest you to go straight for the holy grail, Avidemux reaches > 500 fps decoding H.264 at 720p in software with multi-threading enabled (2 cores i3 with HT). With VA-API hardware accelerated enabled, the speed drops to ~90 fps. nv12_to_uv_mmx in avidemux_core/ADM_coreImage/src/ADM_imageUtils.cpp:248 is the bottleneck.
Don't even try the C version, it is at least twice as slow.

column20: Ported from MLT framework (LGPL/GPL).
column21:
Its fine. Until then i will try to optimize the code more. (The current code is already at least 2x faster than it was right after the initial porting)
So VA-API is a hw decelerator? :)

column20: Ported from MLT framework (LGPL/GPL).
column21:
The current code is already at least 2x faster than it was right after the initial porting

Got it, thanks. I really hope that it can be made at least twice as fast as it is now.

So VA-API is a hw decelerator? :)

As long as hw surfaces don't need to be converted to regular images with deinterleaved chroma, VA-API is great. Even going the opposite way (YV12 --> NV12) is pretty fast. But NV12 --> YV12 is an unmitigated disaster.
The same problem affects DXVA2 hw accel on Windows which also requires NV12 --> YV12 conversion and additionally cannot short-circuit hw decoder and video display.

column20: Ported from MLT framework (LGPL/GPL).
column21: Currently i could only test it on an old Core 2 Quad, but 2x faster (saving with null encoder).

column20: Ported from MLT framework (LGPL/GPL).
column21:
OT:
ADM_imageUtils_asm.asm / nv12_to_u_v_one_line
If i'm not mistaken
psllw          m0,8
psrlw          m0,8
psllw          m1,8
psrlw          m1,8
could be replaced with
pand m0,m4
pand m1,m4
of course m4 must be initialized with the right value, before .nv12_again
Maybe it worth a try, to move
movq           [dstvq],m0
just after
packuswb       m0,m1
(its efficacy depends on how deep&smart the out-of-order mechanism is)

In the preview ui it would be useful to able to have a switch to toggle the effect on/off quickly to be able to see the difference. This would probably be true also for other effects (especially sharpeners on low strength).


For blur and pixelize filter a feature would be to only apply the effect to a selected-region. It's probably not all that useful in practice though (unless you also have face detection).

column21:
Thank you very much, merged. All refinements can be safely done later in the repository.

To toggle state, clicking on the preview or displaying a switch in the preview playback toolbar would work.

The former would break at least the logo filter and could conflict with rubber band, I also doubt that it could be made keyboard-accessible. The latter is the way to go.
Replacing button labels in flyDialog control with icons would allow to reduce the screen real estate occupied by buttons, freeing space for a toggle. Having a preview vs passthrough toggle in flyDialog by default would also allow to drop side-by-side preview in many filters.

Well, first in the Wavelet Sharpener i placed a "Peek Original" button, which only shows the input frame until the button is pressed.
It is part of the filter dialog, not flyDialog, because i realized a global button would break some filter's preview...
I think it has the best UX so far.

I'm going to pull this PR as-is and fix UI/UX in-tree. Luckily, there is no time pressure anymore :-)

column20:
Experimental!
The ADM_ffmp43 multihreading does not cover VP9 encoded videos.
I can play now 4k60fps VP9 videos buttery smooth with this patch. With single thread it was p.i.t.a.
As far as i know ADM_codecFFsimple / class decoderFFSimple is not used elsewhere, but ADM_codecFFVP9  (is this true?).
Im not sure this is the correct way, to enable MT for VP9, but works for now..

column21:
My main goal was to check multithreading works in VP9. I know it should have been made with capability check, but i was too lazy, as i intended this PR as discussion rather an actual patch :)
The frame based multithreading is clearly not working (maybe the codec provides the decoded frames out of order? idk, just guessing)

Maybe adding an applyQuirks() function (I'm bad at inventing names) to decoderFF which derived classes could reimplement to do stuff right before avcodec_open2()?

The parent constructor can not call a virtual function from child class :(

column20:

column21:
The parent constructor can not call a virtual function from child class :(

No, and also unnecessary, was a stupid late night idea. Just split the avcodec_open2 part away from the decoderFFSimple ctor in something like decoderFFSimple::finish(void), so that admCreateFFSimple would call it instead of initialized(). Derived classes like decoderFFVP9 will do their stuff with _context first, then call finish().

column21:
when resize involved in the filter chain, and the closed (but not deleted) preview had different width/height registered, then the actual w/h changed because of the resizer.



I fear I don't quite follow you here. Could you please elaborate?

Sorry :)  So, if there is a resizer instantiated amongst the filters, and (after the "closed preview") it is moved up/down, or the resized dimensions are changed, it will lead to crash (and i suspected it happens because the preview want to read a different sized ADM_Image, that is actually provided to it.)
--
It looks like this patch solved the issue. Thank You!

column21:
So, if there is a resizer instantiated amongst the filters, and (after the "closed preview") it is moved up/down, or the resized dimensions are changed, it will lead to crash (and i suspected it happens because the preview want to read a different sized ADM_Image, that is actually provided to it.)

This would definitely happen if we reuse the previewDialog. No crash for this reason as we don't.
I've pushed the fix. Thank you very much again for noticing the problem.

column20:
Based on Marco Rossini's sharpener. (Heavily optimized, i got 3-4x speedup)
Also there is a new concept for filters: there is a "Peek Original" button. When it is pressed, it will show the unfiltered input, but on release the filtered preview is back again.

Also there is a new concept for filters: there is a "Peek Original" button. When it is pressed, it will show the unfiltered input, but on release the filtered preview is back again.
column21:
Thank you very much for porting this filter.
I wonder whether the peek button could be moved into ADM_flyDialog to reduce code duplication. I like the concept very much.
Not a big deal for now, but I dislike clarifying printString() overlays for 5 reasons: the first three are performance impact, the last two are the font size being inversely proportional to video resolution due to zooming (almost unreadable at 4K, huge and ugly at low resolutions) and the displayed text being not translatable because the font doesn't include non-ASCII characters (well, kanji or hangeul at this pixel size won't be readable anyway).
